lead_paragraph: To the Editor: As a California teacher, I agree that the California tax revolt gutted school financing (Editorial Notebook, Feb. 10). And yes, many ''touchy feely'' trends have had a negative impact on our schools. But Karen Sorlie Russo (letter, Feb. 12) is wrong. Conscientious teachers do not work short hours, and tenure does not mean a lifetime job, only due process in dismissal. We don't get paid for the summer, when many take on work to make ends meet.
abstract: Letter by California teacher, Larry Wiener, says he accepts constructive criticism, not ' just blastings (S)

headline.main: Blame Judges, Not Voters, for California's Declining Schools
